title: LRD v6: Empirical Evidence for Long-Range Dependence / Fractal Memory
description:
Reproducible pipeline and manuscript demonstrating empirical long-range dependence / fractal memory across multiple domains (Bitcoin/crypto volatility, earthquake activity, physiology/HRV, genomics) using DFA-2, bootstrap confidence intervals, and phase-randomized surrogate tests. This package extends LRD v5 (Monte-Carlo validation on synthetic fGn) with real-world empirical evidence.

v6.0.1 Update: Added theoretical addenda linking the macroscopic volatility-memory signal to modern market microstructure universality results, including high-precision evidence for the square-root law (SRL) of price impact across all liquid stocks and traders on the Tokyo Stock Exchange (Sato & Kanazawa, Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 257401, 2025). The SRL demonstrates that universal power laws emerge in financial markets from microscopic agent aggregation â€” analogous to critical phenomena in physics. This provides a mechanistic anchor for interpreting cross-market fractal memory.

Audit Protocol: DFA-2 scaling estimation + block-bootstrap confidence intervals + phase-randomized surrogate falsification + scale-range sensitivity checks.
